results.content:
This class is a very thorough introduction to jQuery and after taking it I feel quite comfortable using jQuery in my own projects.

Edwin is also an excellent teacher. I have completed a total of 18 courses at Udemy and Edwin is among my favorite instructors. He is very passionate about the subject and has a genuine interest in his students. I took his Javascript class previous to this class, and I am currently taking his PHP class and both of those classes are excellent also.

I would highly recommend this class to anyone wanting to get started with jQuery.

results.content: This is a good launchpad for anyone who wants to dip their feet into jQuery before taking a deeper plunge. I've tried learning jQuery numerous different times from numerous other sources and none of them made as much sense to me as Edwin's course. The projects are simple and easy to understand, and Edwin has such a fun and enthusiastic personality. I feel confident enough to move forward and take on bigger, more real-world projects.

The projects are simple and easy to understand, and Edwin has such a fun and enthusiastic personality. I feel confident enough to move forward and take on bigger, more real-world projects.

results.content: This is a great introductory course to JQuery framework.  It provides good overview of jQuery syntax and its use within HTML.  In my opinion, it is best to have basic understanding to both HTML and CSS, as well as JavaScript.  Edwin does good job providing examples of jQuery in use in short "to the point" set of lectures.  Coding along definitely helps solidify the topics as the preview functionality in Brackets editor provides instant feedback of what the code renders on a browser page.  This is a second course done by Edwin I took and I not disappointed.  Great work Edwin!
results.content_html: This is a great introductory course to JQuery framework. It provides good overview of jQuery syntax and its use within HTML. In my opinion, it is best to have basic understanding to both HTML and CSS, as well as JavaScript. Edwin does good job providing examples of jQuery in use in short "to the point" set of lectures. Coding along definitely helps solidify the topics as the preview functionality in Brackets editor provides instant feedback of what the code renders on a browser page. This is a second course done by Edwin I took and I not disappointed. Great work Edwin!

results.content:
Edwin is very enthusiastic! You can tell that he is genuinely trying to provide something of value to help people. 

He is constantly talking about practicing with him. I personally would watch videos once without practice and then go back and practice with him. This works for me, and helped me not get too overwhelmed at the begining. 

Thank you Edwin!

results.content: Edwin Diaz does it again! I knew little about jQuery beforehand and after finishing his course, I feel supercharged and confident to tackle basic front-end development projects. I had so many "aha!" moments as I was coding along, I lost count! The material is bite-sized (~10mins max), the presentations are clear and are easily digestable. As recommendws, if at first you don't understand a topic, redo it again and again until it does make sense. Trust in Edwin; you won't be disappointed!
results.content_html: Edwin Diaz does it again! I knew little about jQuery beforehand and after finishing his course, I feel supercharged and confident to tackle basic front-end development projects. I had so many "aha!" moments as I was coding along, I lost count! The material is bite-sized (~10mins max), the presentations are clear and are easily digestable. As recommendws, if at first you don't understand a topic, redo it again and again until it does make sense. Trust in Edwin; you won't be disappointed!

results.content:
If you are not familiar with jQuery this is the course to take. It shows you step by step what jQuery is and what you can do with it. Some JS knowledge is necessary (to better understand it). 
You will not build a project using jQuery, but course will show you how/when/where you can use it.

I would recommend to take his FREE emmet course http://bit.ly/1L8j6sW
With emmet you do really code faster.

results.content: Thanks Edwin, I learnt a lot from you. I can see your gushing passion in teaching and education. Hope to see more courses from you!
results.content_html: Thanks Edwin, I learnt a lot from you. I can see your gushing passion in teaching and education. Hope to see more courses from you!

results.content: I just finished the course and I can definitely conclude a few things.  First, the teacher is positive, uplifting, and well spoken.  This really helps keep you feeling good from lecture to lecture.  Second, the class is very bare bones, but that is a good thing in this case.  This allows you to jump right in, rather than wading through tons of background information before getting to actually code.  Furthermore, since all of the exercises are short and utilize a lot of similar approaches, you get used to the syntax very quickly.  I actually caught this course during a 50% off offer.  I only paid $10! Now I feel a lot more comfortable getting out there and looking through jQuery to teach myself more.
results.content_html: I just finished the course and I can definitely conclude a few things. First, the teacher is positive, uplifting, and well spoken. This really helps keep you feeling good from lecture to lecture. Second, the class is very bare bones, but that is a good thing in this case. This allows you to jump right in, rather than wading through tons of background information before getting to actually code. Furthermore, since all of the exercises are short and utilize a lot of similar approaches, you get used to the syntax very quickly. I actually caught this course during a 50% off offer. I only paid $10! Now I feel a lot more comfortable getting out there and looking through jQuery to teach myself more.

results.content: It's good course for begineers in Jquery.It teaches basics of Jquery for simple and interactive things for our web apps and website development.
results.content_html: It's good course for begineers in Jquery.It teaches basics of Jquery for simple and interactive things for our web apps and website development.

results.content: This course was OK. This is the second course I have taken from this instructor and just like the other one, he doesn't indent his code, makes numerous mistakes, and does not explain concepts in-depth. Instead of explaining exactly what something does, he'll say, "Or something like that." When you are an instructor and considered an expert in order to teach it, you need to have a clear understanding yourself first. He shows more than he explains and assumes you will make the connections yourself. This was a good refresher for me since I already know jQuery but not the best for a true beginner. The organization of the course was also weird. Some parts shown later on could have been lumped together with previous material.
